title: Quiz 2 - Mensuration 2D
instruction: Directions (49-50): To answer the following questions, which of the information given in the Statements A), B), C) and D) or 1), 2), 3) and 4) below is/are necessary/ sufficient?

quiz.text: From four corners of a square sheet of side 4 cm, four pieces, each in the shape of arc of a circle with radius 2 cm, are cut out. The area of the remaining portion is:
options: (8 – π) sq. cm.
(16 – 4π) sq. cm.
(16 – 8π) sq. cm.
(4 – 2π) sq. cm.
None of these

quiz.text: A kite in the shape of a square with a diagonal 32 cm attached to an equilateral triangle of the base 8 cm. Approximately how much paper has been used to make it? (Use  = 1.732)
options: 539.712
538.721
540.712
539.217
None of these

quiz.text: The breadth of a rectangular hall is three-fourth of its length. If the area of the floor is 768 sq. m., then the difference between the length and breadth of the hall is:
options: 8 metres
12 metres
24 metres
32 metres
None of these

quiz.text: The length of a rectangular garden is 10 metres and its breadth is 5 metres. Find the length of the diagonal of a square garden having the same area as that of the rectangular garden:
options: 10 m
9 m
13 m
8 m
None of these

quiz.text: A took 15 sec. to cross a rectangular field diagonally walking at the rate of 52 m/min. and B took the same time to cross the same field along its sides walking at the rate of 68 m/min. The area of the field is:
options: 30
40
50
60
None of these

quiz.text: There is a rectangular tank of length 180 m and breadth 120 m in a circular field. If the area of the land portion of the field is 40000 , what is the radius of the field? (Take π = 22/7)
options: 130 m
135 m
140 m
145 m
None of these

quiz.text: If the length and breadth of a rectangle are in the ratio 3 : 2 and its perimeter is 20 cm, then the area of the rectangle (in sq. metre ) is:
options: 24
48
72
96
None of these

quiz.text: A path of uniform width which runs round the inside of a rectangular field 38 m long and 32 m wide. If the path occupies 600 m2 area , then the width of the path is?
options: 30 m
5 m
18.75 m
10 m
None of these

quiz.text: The length of a room floor exceeds its breadth by 20 m. The area of the floor remains unaltered when the length is decreased by 10 m but the breadth is increased by 5 m. The area of the floor (in square metres) is:
options: 280
325
300
420
None of these

quiz.text: In measuring the sides of a rectangle, there is an excess of 5% on one side and 2% deficit on the other. Then the error percent in the area is
options: 3.3%
3.0%
2.9%
2.7%
None of these

quiz.text: The area of a rectangle is thrice that of a square. The length of the rectangle is 30 cm and the breadth of the rectangle is same as the side of  square. The side of the square (in cm) is
options: 10
20
30
60
None of these

quiz.text: If the area of a triangle is 1176  and base : corresponding altitude is 3 : 4, then the altitude of the triangle is:
options: 42 cm
52 cm
54 cm
56 cm
None of these

quiz.text: If D and E are the mid-points of the side AB and AC respectively of the ∆ABC in the figure given here, the shaded region of the triangle is what percent of the whole triangular region?
options: 50%
25%
75%
60%
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of base of two triangle is x : y and that of their areas is a : b. Then the ratio of their corresponding altitudes will be:
options: x:y
ax : by
ay : bx
a:b
None of these

quiz.text: From a point in the interior of an equilateral triangle, the length of the perpendicular to the three sides are 6 cm, 8 cm and 10 cm respectively. The area of the triangle is
options: 48
16
192
192
None of these

quiz.text: ABC is an equilateral triangle of side 2 cm. With A, B, C as centre and radius 1 cm three arcs are drawn. The area of the region within the triangle bounded by the three arcs is
options: 2
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of length of each equal side and the third side of an isosceles triangle is 3 : 4. If the area of the triangle is 18 square units, the third side is?
options: 16 units
5 units
8 units
12 units
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of sides of a triangle is 3 : 4 : 5 and area of the triangle is 72 square unit. Then the area of an equilateral triangle whose perimeter is same as that of the previous triangle is
options: 32 square units
48 square units
96 square units
60 square units
None of these

quiz.text: The height of an equilateral triangle is 15 cm. The area of the triangle is?
options: 50 sq. cm.
70 sq. cm.
75 sq. cm.
150 sq. cm.
None of these

quiz.text: The altitude drawn to the base of an isosceles triangle is 8 cm and its perimeter is 64 cm. The area (in cm2) of the triangle is
options: 240
180
360
120
None of these

quiz.text: PQRS is the diameter of a circle of radius 6 cm. The lengths PQ, QR and RS are equal. Semi-circles are drawn with PQ and QS as diameters as shown in the figure alongside. Find the ratio of the area of the shaded region to that of the unshaded region.
options: 1 : 2
25 : 121
5 : 18
4 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: Find the area of the shaded region if the radius of each of the circles is 1 cm.
options: 2
√3 - π/6
√3 - π/2
None of these

quiz.text: Find the area of the equilateral triangle inscribed in a circle circumscribed by a square made by joining the mid-points of the adjacent sides of a square of side .
options: None of these

quiz.text: Find the perimeter and area of the shaded portion of the adjoining diagram: Note : The radius of circles = 10 cm
options: 90.85 cm, 413.7 cm2
181.6 cm, 423.7 cm2
90.8 cm, 827.4 cm2
181.6 cm, 827.4 cm2
None of these

quiz.text: Two goats are tethered to diagonally opposite vertices of a field formed by joining the mid-points of the adjacent sides of another square field of side m. What is the total grazing area of the two goats if the length of the rope by which the goats are tethered is 10m?
options: 100
50
None of these

quiz.text: In the adjoining figure, AOBCA represents a quadrant of a circle of radius 3.5 cm with centre O. Calculate the area of the shaded portion.
options: 6.5 sq. cm
15 sq. cm
5.125 sq. cm
6.125 sq. cm
None of these

quiz.text: Find the area of the trapezium ABCD.
options: None of these

quiz.text: Four equal circles each of radius ‘a’ units touch one another. The area enclosed between them (π = 22/7), in square units, is
options: None of these

quiz.text: Three coins of the same size (radius 1 cm) are placed on a table such that each of them touches the other two. The area enclosed by the coins is
options: None of these

quiz.text: The area of the shaded region in the figure given below is
options: 2(π – 1)   sq. units
(π – 1) sq. units
( – 1)   sq. units
(π – ) sq. units
None of these

quiz.text: The circumference of circle is 11 cm and the angle of a sector of the circle is 60°. The area of the sector is (use π = 22/7)
options: 2
None of these

quiz.text: The four equal circles of radius 4 cm drawn on the four corners of a square touch each other externally. Then the area of the portion in the square and the four sectors is?
options: 9(π – 4) sq. cm.
16(π – 4) sq. cm.
9(4 – π) sq. cm.
16(4 – π) sq. cm.
None of these

quiz.text: The perimeter of a semicircular path is 36 m. Find the area of this semicircular path.
options: 42 sq. m
54 sq. m
63 sq. m
77 sq. m
None of these

quiz.text: The area of a circle is proportional to the square of its radius. A small circle of radius 3 cm is drawn within a larger circle of radius 5 cm. Find the ratio of the area of the annular zone to the area of the larger circle. (Area of the annular zone is the difference between the area of the larger circle and that of the smaller circle).
options: 9 : 16
9 : 25
16 : 25
16 : 27
None of these

quiz.text: If the difference between areas of the circumcircle and the incircle of an equilateral triangle is 44 , then the area of the triangle is. (Take π = 22/7)
options: 28
7
14
21
None of these

quiz.text: A circle is inscribed in an equilateral triangle and a square is inscribed in that circle. The ratio of the area of the triangle and the square is?
options: 2:
2
3
2: 1
None of these

quiz.text: Between a square of perimeter 44 cm and a circle of circumference 44 cm, which figure has larger area and by how much?
options: Square, 33
Circle, 33
Both have equal area
Square, 495
None of these

quiz.text: A wire, when bent in the form of a square, encloses a region having area 121 . If the same wire is bent into the form of a circle, then the area of the circle is (Take π = 22/7)
options: 144
180
154
176
None of these

quiz.text: At each corner of a triangular field of sides 26 m, 28 m and 30 m, a cow is tethered by a rope of length 7 m. The area (in sq. m ) ungrazed by the cows is?
options: 336
259
154
77
None of these

quiz.text: A cow is tied on the corner of a rectangular field of size 30 m × 20 m by a 14 m long rope. The area of the region, that she can graze, is? (use π = 22/7):
options: 350
196
154
22
None of these

quiz.text: If the length of a rectangle is increased by 25% and the width is decreased by 20%, then the area of the rectangle:
options: increases by 5%
decreases by 5%
remains unchanged
increases by 10%
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of the length of the parallel sides of a trapezium is 3 : 2. The shortest distance between them is 15 cm. If the area of the trapezium is 450 , the sum of the length of the parallel sides is
options: 15 cm
36 cm
42 cm
60 cm
None of these

quiz.text: Two circles with centre A and B and radius 2 units touch each other externally at ‘C’. A third circle with centre ‘C’ and radius ‘2’ units meets other two at D and E. Then the area of the quadrilateral ABDE is?
options: 2 sq. units
3  sq. units
4 sq. units
sq. units
None of these

quiz.text: The difference between the radii of the bigger circle and smaller circle is 14 cm and the difference between their areas is 1056 . Radius of the smaller circle is
options: 7 cm
5 cm
9 cm
3 cm
None of these

quiz.text: If the lengths of the sides AB, BC and CA of a triangle ABC are 10 cm, 8 cm and 6 cm respectively and if M is the mid-point of BC and MN || AB to cut AC at N, then the area of the trapezium ABMN is equal to?
options: 18 sq. cm
20 sq. cm
12 sq. cm
16 sq. cm
None of these

quiz.text: What is the circumference of the circle given below. AB is the diameter and XY is perpendicular to AB?
options: 8π cm
π √34 cm
16π/3 cm
π √31/3 cm
none of these

quiz.text: A solid cube made of steel is melted and recast such that its length, breadth and height changes as +10%, +10%, -20%. What is the percentage change in surface area of this cube?
options: No change
+1%
-2%
-1%
None of these

quiz.text: An equilateral triangle of side 6 cm has its corners cut-off to form a regular hexagon. Area (in cm2) of this hexagon will be?
options: 3√3
6√3
5√3/2
3√6
none of these

quiz.text: What is the area of the rectangle?  I. The ratio of length to breadth of the rectangle is 35 : 12.  II. The perimeter of the rectangle is 188 cm.  III. The length of diagonal of the rectangle is 74 cm
options: I and II only
I and III only
(I and II) or (II and III)
Any two of the three
(I and II) or (I and III) only

quiz.text: What is the perimeter of a rectangular garden? A. The area of the garden is 1200 m2. B. The diagonal of the garden is 50m. C. The ratio between the length and breadth of the garden is 4:3.
options: Any two of them
Only C
All three are required.
Either B or C only
None
